page.title: 09Geography
page.content: There are mostly fields in our area. In some of the woods there are different animals and birds like badgers, foxes, owls, voles, squirrels and wood-peckers. The area looks very attactive. Some fields are covered in crops and some are just grass for hay or grazing. There are more conifers than deciduous trees. {Geology.} Leintwardine stands 440 F.T above sea level at the church and has a fairly dry climate with an average rainfall of 27.8".(The lowest rain fall recorded locally was 20.4"and the highest 41.99"in 1960).The beautiful scenery of the district around Leintwardine has had a varied development. The rocks are very old, about 350 million years, and they formed when this part of the world was under the sea.
